Flagship Work: Architected [AI-DATA-ANALYTICS] and [Dev-Roadmap] (See Case Studies).

caseStudy.context: Non-technical stakeholders struggled to extract insights from raw CSV datasets, creating a bottleneck for data analysts.
caseStudy.constraint: Data privacy requirements strictly prohibited uploading raw CSV content to external LLM providers.
caseStudy.failure: Initial direct-prompting approach resulted in 40% hallucinated column names and invalid SQL syntax.
caseStudy.fix: Architected a 'Schema-Only' RAG pipeline. The system extracts only the metadata (headers, types) to generate a prompt, keeping actual row data local.
caseStudy.result: Reduced query hallucinations to <5% and enabled instant chart generation for 10k+ row datasets.
caseStudy.lesson: Context window management is more critical than model size for structured data tasks.

decisions.reason: Prevents data leakage while providing sufficient structure for the LLM to generate valid Pandas/SQL queries.
Allows immediate in-memory processing without setting up a dedicated SQL database instance for every user.

validation.setup: Automated regression test suite against known correct SQL outputs

caseStudy.context: Self-taught developers often get lost in 'tutorial hell' without a structured, dependency-aware learning path.
caseStudy.constraint: Needed to persist progress across sessions without forcing users to sign up/authenticate.
caseStudy.failure: Initial basic list structure failed to visualize dependencies (e.g., 'Learn React BEFORE Redux').
caseStudy.fix: Implemented a Directed Acyclic Graph (DAG) visualization engine to enforce prerequisite locking.
caseStudy.result: Reduced user drop-off by 25% by clearly showing 'Next Available Steps'.
caseStudy.lesson: Visualizing structure reduces cognitive load for learners.

decisions.reason: Zero-friction for new users; no database costs.

tradeoffs.pros: Total control over styling and interaction.
tradeoffs.cons: High initial dev effort vs using a library like React Flow.
tradeoffs.reason: React Flow was too heavy (bundle size) for the simple DAG needed.

validation.setup: Achieved 98/100 Performance score on mobile networks

caseStudy.context: Manual code reviews are inconsistent and often miss subtle anti-patterns in large diffs.
caseStudy.constraint: Feedback system needed to be near-instant (<5s) to be useful in a dev loop.
caseStudy.failure: Sending entire files to LLM caused timeouts and hit token limits immediately.
caseStudy.fix: Built an AST-based chunker that identifies changed functions and only analyzes relevant scopes.
caseStudy.result: Reduced token usage by 70% and latency to ~3.5s per file.
caseStudy.lesson: Preprocessing code (AST analysis) is cheaper and faster than post-processing LLM output.

decisions.reason: Maximizes signal-to-noise ratio for the LLM.

tradeoffs.cons: Lower raw compute performance than Rust/Go.
tradeoffs.reason: Rich ecosystem of JS parsers (Acorn, Babel) outweighed raw speed.

validation.setup: Sustained 50 concurrent review requests without degradation

caseStudy.context: Tracking fleet assets requires real-time visibility, but mobile networks are unreliable.
caseStudy.constraint: Must handle network drops without losing location history trails.
caseStudy.failure: Simple WebSocket emission resulted in gaps in the path when network flickered.
caseStudy.fix: Implemented a local 'Store-and-Forward' queue (IndexedDB) that syncs bursts when connection restores.
caseStudy.result: 100% path integrity even with 50% simulated packet loss.
caseStudy.lesson: Assume the network is always broken.

decisions.reason: Bi-directional heartbeat capability makes connection state easier to manage than raw HTTP.

tradeoffs.pros: Extremely fast read/write for live locations.
tradeoffs.reason: Speed was prioritized over long-term archival for this live-view prototype.

endorsements.quote: We face a similar challenge at RAI AI, prioritizing speed while processing cross-platform data streams where minutes of latency translate to missed opportunities.
endorsements.author: Dmytro B.
